metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34866 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges onaffected installations of Linux Kernel 5.14-rc3. An attacker must firstobtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system inorder to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within thehandling of eBPF programs. The issue results from the lack of propervalidation of user-supplied eBPF programs, which can result in a typeconfusion condition. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability toescalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of thekernel. Was ZDI-CAN-14689.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
